intro: Seriphidium karatavicum, commonly known as the Karatavicum tansy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with limited water availability. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic vegetation.
